alert.note: Alert for George; Greene; Perry; Stone (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 03 at 3:00PM CST until February 03 at 3:45PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Mobile County in southwestern Alabama... Washington County in southwestern Alabama... Central Clarke County in southwestern Alabama... George County in southeastern Mississippi... Southern Perry County in southeastern Mississippi... Greene County in southeastern Mississippi... Stone County in southeastern Mississippi... * Until 345 PM CST. * At 259 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles southeast of McHenry to 9 miles south of McLain to 5 miles southeast of Leakesville to 4 miles west of Tibbie, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Jackson, Wiggins, Citronelle, Lucedale, Chatom, Leakesville, Saint Stephens, Wagarville, Leroy, Perkinston, McHenry, Gulfcrest, Deer Park, Tibbie, Calvert, McLain, State Line, Fruitdale and McIntosh. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for southwestern Alabama...and southeastern Mississippi.
